Common ExpressionğŸ”—

  • Thereâ€™s a wonderful line I came across -> Thereâ€™s a wonderful quote I found
  • My girlfriend is on her period.
  • Tens of millions of Chinese are currently unable to leave their homes. All face being taken to isolation centres, should they test positive or be declared close contacts of a virus-carrier. A grim fate for anyone, centralised quarantine is terrifying for pet-owners, who must scramble to find a shelter or someone to foster their animals. If they fail, the creatures may starve in an empty flat orâ€”as has happened in several citiesâ€”be bludgeoned to death by workers sent to disinfect homes.
  • Never that will happen.
  • Do you often work overtime in your company?

Chat TopicsğŸ”—

  • å¯¹è¯å¯åŠ¨å™¨
  • å¯¹è¯é—®é¢˜
  • Good Questions
  • What did you eat for breakfast?
  • Whatâ€™s your favorite food?

  • Do you have a pet? dog or cat? whatâ€™s its name? whatâ€™s its breed?
  • Have you read any impressive books recently?
    • Have you read any impressive articles recently?
    • Have you watch any impressive tv shows/movies recently?
  • What website do you usually visit?
  • Where is one place youâ€™d love to travel again?
    • where have you traveled?
  • what projects are you working on now?
  • Do you collect anything?

  • Where do you get your news?
  • What was the last photo you took?
  • Is there anything youâ€™ve bought thatâ€™s not expensive but works well?

  • Whatâ€™s the best and worst thing about the country you are from?
  • What are your best tips for learning English?

First ConversationğŸ”—

~Hello! Pleased to meet you. My name isâ€¦ Whatâ€™s your name?

~My name isâ€¦ Nice to meet you too.

~How are you today?

~Iâ€™m well, and you?

~Iâ€™m fine thanks/Iâ€™m tired, please go easy on me!

~Where are you from?

~Iâ€™m fromâ€¦ And you?

~Where do you live?

~I live inâ€¦

~How old are you?

~I amâ€¦ years old.

~What do you do for a living?

~Iâ€™m a student. Iâ€™m studyingâ€¦

~I work asâ€¦

~I am retired.

~What would you like to do when you finish your studies?

~Tell me about a typical day at work.

~Do you have any hobbies?

~How long have you been learningâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜How long have you been learning Spanish?â€™

~I have been learningâ€¦ forâ€¦ months/years.

~Why do you want to learnâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜Why do you want to learn Spanish?â€™

~I want to learnâ€¦ because/toâ€¦ â€“ e.g. â€˜I want to learn Spanish to surprise my grandparents. They are from Madrid.â€™

~Have you ever been toâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜Have you ever been to Cuba?â€™

~Yes, last year/â€¦ years ago.

~No, I havenâ€™t, but Iâ€™d like to go one day.

~What did you like most aboutâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜What did you like most about Cuba?â€™

~I lovedâ€¦

~Did you like it?

~I liked it/No, I didnâ€™t.

~Whatâ€™s your favourite book/movie/song?

~My favourite book/movie/song isâ€¦

~What is the book/movie/song about?

~The book/movie/song is aboutâ€¦

~Who is your favourite actor/singer/author? What do you like about them?

~My favourite actor/singer/author isâ€¦ I love the fact thatâ€¦

~Can you cook?

~Yes, I can/No, I canâ€™t.

~Whatâ€™s your favourite food?

~My favourite food isâ€¦

~Do you likeâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜Do you like pasta?â€™

~Yes, I love it/No, I donâ€™t.

~Do you preferâ€¦ orâ€¦ â€“ e.g. â€˜Do you prefer Thai or Vietnamese?â€™

~Do you play any sports?

~Yes, I playâ€¦/No, I donâ€™t.

~What sport do you like?

~I likeâ€¦/I donâ€™t like any sports.

~Do you have any pets?

~Yes, I have aâ€¦ His/her name isâ€¦/No, I donâ€™t have any pets.

~What do you like to do in your free time?

~I likeâ€¦

~Tell me about your last holiday. Where did you go? Did you travel with someone or by yourself?

~My last holiday was inâ€¦ I went withâ€¦/by myself.

~What did you do there?

~I visitedâ€¦ I had a great time!

~Would you ratherâ€¦ orâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜Would you rather be invisible or be able to read peopleâ€™s minds?â€™

~Iâ€™d rather beâ€¦ â€“ e.g. â€˜Iâ€™d rather be invisibleâ€™.

~Whatâ€™s on your bucket list?

~Iâ€™m sorry, I didnâ€™t understand. Can you repeat, please?

~Got it, thanks!

~Could you please talk slower?

~How do you sayâ€¦ inâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜How do you say cheers! in Italian?â€™

~What doesâ€¦ mean? â€“ e.g. â€˜What does salute! mean?â€™

~It meansâ€¦ â€“ e.g. â€˜It means cheers! â€™

~How do you spell that?

~What are your plans for the weekend?

~This weekend, I willâ€¦

~I have no plans for the weekend.

~OK, thatâ€™s all for today. Iâ€™ll see you next week.

~Thanks for your help! See you next week.

Following conversation sessionsğŸ”—

~What do you think aboutâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜What do you think about space tourism?â€™

~I think itâ€™s a good/bad idea.

~I think itâ€™s good news/a serious issue.

~Do you think itâ€™s important toâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜Do you think itâ€™s important to believe in yourself?â€™

~I think so/I donâ€™t think so.

~In my opinion, itâ€™s important/not important becauseâ€¦

~Do you think itâ€™s possibleâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜Do you think itâ€™s possible to never lie?â€™

~It depends/Itâ€™s possible.

~I think so/I donâ€™t think so.

~Do you agree withâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜Do you agree with gun control?â€™

~I agree with it/I disagree with it.

~What is the difference betweenâ€¦ andâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜What is the difference between a good beer and a great one?â€™

~The difference isâ€¦

~Have you everâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜Have you ever been skydiving?â€™

~Yes, I have/No, I havenâ€™t. ~Wasâ€¦ better in the past or now? â€“ e.g. â€˜Was fashion better in the past or now?â€™

~It is better now becauseâ€¦/It was better in the past becauseâ€¦

~What are the advantages/benefits ofâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜What are the advantages of working from home?â€™

~The advantages/benefits areâ€¦

~What are the disadvantages ofâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜What are the disadvantages of working from home?â€™

~The disadvantages areâ€¦

~What is the best/worst thing aboutâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜What is the best/worst thing about renting a house?â€™

~The best/worst thing aboutâ€¦ isâ€¦

~Who do you think is the greatest person in history?

~I think the greatest person in history isâ€¦

~What do you like most aboutâ€¦ â€“ e.g. â€˜What do you like most about your country?â€™

~What do you like least aboutâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜What do you like least about your country?â€™

~What makes a goodâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜What makes a good friendship?â€™

~What can we do toâ€¦ â€“ e.g. â€˜What can we do to help the environment?â€™

~When you were a child/teenager, did youâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜When you were a child/teenager, did you watch cartoons?â€™

~Now that you are an adult, do you stillâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜Now that you are an adult, do you still watch cartoons?â€™

~Whoâ€¦ the most? Kids or adults? â€“ e.g. â€˜Who watches TV the most? Kids or adults?â€™

~Do you thinkâ€¦ is for everyone or is aimed more at children/adolescents/adults? â€“ e.g. â€˜Do you think the Harry Potter movies are for everyone or are they aimed more at children/adolescents/adults?â€™

~What would you do ifâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜What would you do if you won a million dollars?â€™

~Do you preferâ€¦ orâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜Do you prefer to wake up early or sleep in?â€™

~Do you preferâ€¦ alone or with someone? â€“ e.g. â€˜Do you prefer travelling alone or with someone?â€™

~If you couldâ€¦, what would you do? â€“ e.g. â€˜If you could fly, what would you do?â€™

~Have you ever heard ofâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜Have you ever heard of the game Dungeons & Dragons ?â€™

~Yes, Iâ€™ve heard of it/No, itâ€™s the first time Iâ€™ve heard of it.

~Did you know thatâ€¦ â€“ e.g. â€˜Did you know that karate, skateboarding, baseball and surfing will be part of the next Olympic games?â€™

~What are the risks ofâ€¦? â€“ e.g. â€˜What are the risks of never taking a risk?â€™

AdvancedğŸ”—

ApologizingğŸ”—

Donâ€™t be upset, but . . .

It was a slip of the tongue.

I said it by mistake.

I am sorry that . . .

(Dis)agreeingğŸ”—

One hundred percent.

Without question.

Exactly right.

Most certainly.

Without doubt.

In no way . . .

That isnâ€™t true at all.

That is an exaggeration.

I really canâ€™t believe that.

In principle that is true, but . . .

Admittedly that is true, but . . .

Thatâ€™s one way to say it.

Only up to a certain point.

Certainly. Why not?

I agree.

ClosingğŸ”—

That is all there is to say.

That is all for now.

To sum up . . .

And there is the problem.

I hope it is only a matter of time.

That remains to be seen.

FilerğŸ”—

Understandably.

Frankly speaking . . .

Between you and me . . .

Anyway . . .

Well then . . .

Well, as a matter of fact . . .

How can I put it?

I must say that . . .

First . . .

Second . . .

I would like you to know that . . .

I am afraid that . . .

Now and then it seems to me that . . .

After all . . .

As far as I am concerned . . .

More and more . . .

Actually . . .

All joking aside . . .

Now seriously . . .

ElaboratingğŸ”—

To be more precise . . .

And whatâ€™s more . . .

Since I am already talking about it . . .

I would like to emphasize that . . .

Should I explain in greater detail?

Allow me to say it another way.

That is to say . . .

Nevertheless . . .

Even though . . .

That sounds like . . .

And that is why . . .

OpeningğŸ”—

Thank you very much.

That is a good question.

That is such a difficult question.

Once upon a time, long ago . . .

PassingğŸ”—

Can you tell me please . . . ?

Would you be interested in us talking about something else?

And what do you think?

QualifyingğŸ”—

To tell you the truth . . .

I presume that . . .

I hope that . . .

In my opinion . . .

If that is true . . .

I donâ€™t know exactly.

I would like to think that . . .

The way I see it is that . . .

As you may know . . .

I donâ€™t have a big interest in that.

If I understand correctly . . .

As you already know . . .

That isnâ€™t such a big problem.

That is a matter of opinion.

As far as I know . . .

I have the impression that . . .

It is usually true that . . .

You never know, but . . .

I havenâ€™t thought about it before, but . . .

If I am not mistaken . . .

I am not certain whether . . .

Like every other man/woman . . .

I have my own opinion on it, but . . .

I am not an expert, but . . .

QuotingğŸ”—

He/she said something like . . .

My wife/husband pointed out that . . .

Recently, I heard that . . .

My better half said . . .

SwitchingğŸ”—

Now it occurs to me that . . .

By the way . . .

I have an interesting story about it.

And besides that . . .

Oh, I nearly forgot . . .

And one more thing . . .

On the other hand . . .
